description:
An open-source alternative to Claude Cowork, powered by OpenCode

OpenWork is an extensible, open-source “Claude Work” style system for knowledge workers.
It’s a native desktop app that runs OpenCode under the hood, but presents it as a clean, guided workflow:
- pick a workspace
- start a run
- watch progress + plan updates
- approve permissions when needed
- reuse what works (templates + skills)
The goal: make “agentic work” feel like a product, not a terminal.
Highlights
- Added the Den control plane and a new cloud worker web app with a 3-step setup flow, persisted workers, and connect guidance.
- Gated cloud workers behind Polar entitlements and defaulted worker provisioning to the Render standard plan.
Fixes & polish
- Completed the provider OAuth connect flow in the modal.
- Fixed cloud remote-connect compatibility by returning workspace-scoped connect URLs and compatible worker tokens.
- Improved worker launch reliability with asynchronous provisioning and auto-polling.
- Fixed editor mode file opening and removed reasoning text from the session step timeline.
Packaging / ops
- Added CI deployment workflow and service scaffolding for Den.
- Included AUR updates and bumped workspace packages to 0.11.114.
